column4: once i install w32codecs and mozilla mplayer with firefox plugin, i should be able to see windows medai files on the net right? For example ctv.ca
with w32codecs yes it shouldn't be a problem
been struggling for awhile and read all ubuntuguide.org and all wikis on net
so exactly what's your issue now? And can you throw me a site that isn't working? I had issues with WMVs earlier and fixed it, hopefully we can do the same here
will just go test, won't be a second
try a video there, it uses windows media player
getting video, no sound here, though that may be only as I had installed essentials - so where are you at so far - have you installed mplayer mozilla plugin and w32codecs?
maybe i have to create a link in the plugins folder in firefox
haha, sound actually did work, but something went funky on my system - does normal media work with mozilla-mplayer?
once it does I'll throw you the guide to get WMV on Linux
I think the links are out of date, but the method still works - just go to mplayer.hq and download the essentials or all codec package
once that's done tell me how it goes, would be interested myself. I did the same thing for an Australian news service to get their WMVs working
